medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe dyspnea at rest and lower limb edema during 31 weeks of gestation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began during second pregnancy; patient was diagnosed with primary pulmonary hypertension (PPH) 2 years prior after cardiac decompensation 5 months post complicated delivery. Reappeared at 31 weeks gestation, with worsening dyspnea, dilated neck veins, and edema. Follow-up echocardiography showed progressive right heart dilation during pregnancy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with primary pulmonary hypertension (PPH) 2 years prior, following a complicated delivery.
medical_history.family_history: Family history positive for daytime sleepiness, less severe than patient's condition. Noted enlargement of right atrial and ventricular diameters.
medical_history.social_history: No alcohol or tobacco use reported. Patient had a life-long history of sleepiness that worsened over the last 8 years.
